docs.snippet: China has slapped extra tariffs of up to 25 percent on 128 U.S. products including frozen pork, as well as on wine and certain fruits and nuts, in response to U.S. duties on imports of aluminum and steel, China's finance ministry said.

headline.print_headline: China Imposes Additional Tariffs in Response to U.S. Duties on Steel, Aluminum
headline.main: China Imposes Additional Tariffs in Response to U.S. Duties on Steel, Aluminum

docs.snippet: U.S. 9th Circuit Court of Appeals Judge Stephen Reinhardt has died after a 37-year career as a liberal icon on the bench during which he struck down California’s same-sex marriage ban and called President Donald Trump's immigration policy in...

headline.print_headline: U.S. Appeals Court Judge Reinhardt Known as the 'Liberal Lion', Dies
headline.main: U.S. Appeals Court Judge Reinhardt Known as the 'Liberal Lion', Dies

docs.snippet: Black Lives Matter activists protested again in Sacramento on Thursday over the shooting of an unarmed black man by police, calling for criminal charges against the officers after an emotional funeral service for the 22-year-old father of two.

headline.print_headline: Sacramento Protests Resume After Family Buries Stephon Clark
headline.main: Sacramento Protests Resume After Family Buries Stephon Clark

docs.snippet: France's president on Thursday assured the Kurdish-dominated Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) of Paris' support to stabilise northeastern Syria against Islamic State, and Kurdish officials said he had committed to sending troops to the region.

headline.print_headline: France's Macron Vows Support for Northern Syrians, Kurdish Militia
headline.main: France's Macron Vows Support for Northern Syrians, Kurdish Militia

docs.snippet: Shares fell in Europe and Asia on Wednesday as tech stocks extended losses following sell-offs of their U.S. peers overnight. Investors are selling technology-related shares on concern governments might tighten scrutiny over Facebook after it was ...

headline.print_headline: Global Stock Markets Sink, Slammed by Tech Losses
headline.main: Global Stock Markets Sink, Slammed by Tech Losses

docs.snippet: Years after moving to Britain as part of a spy swap, a former Russian spy was poisoned. Many Western officials believe Moscow is responsible. What happened?

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: A Cold War Flashback

docs.snippet: Events are unfolding quickly on the Korean peninsula with planned summits between North and South Korea and the United States, a presidential official in Seoul said on Tuesday, amid  reports that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is in China.

headline.print_headline: South Korea Says Watching Beijing 'Very Closely' Amid Reports of Kim Visit
headline.main: South Korea Says Watching Beijing 'Very Closely' Amid Reports of Kim Visit

docs.snippet: Joseph P. Ganim, an ex-convict who was re-elected mayor of Bridgeport, is now running for governor of Connecticut, and that worries fellow Democrats.

headline.print_headline: In Connecticut, the Mayor of Second Chances
headline.main: From City Hall to Prison and Back, Ganim Now Eyes Governor’s Mansion
